paper_abstract: Petri nets, a formal model for concurrent and distributed systems, have been widely applied in system modeling and analysis in almost every branch of computer science and many other scientific and engineering disciplines in the past half century. In this comprehensive survey, we review some major developments of Petri nets that have enhanced their modeling capabilities and in particular the methods to incorporate well-known software engineering development paradigms in Petri nets to support general software system modeling.
paper_title: A COMPREHENSIVE SURVEY OF PETRI NET MODELING IN SOFTWARE ENGINEERING
